title: Deepika Padukone Raises A Valid Point, Asks Why #MeToo Is Only For Film Stars & Not Cricketers
text:
Deepika Padukone Raises A Valid Point, Asks Why #MeToo Is Only For Film Stars & Not Cricketers

Deepika Padukone Raises A Valid Point, Asks Why #MeToo Is Only For Film Stars & Not Cricketers

It's been a year since Tanushree Dutta kickstarted the #MeToo movement in India. The movement triggered several reactions and many were accused of harassment at work place, especially, the Indian film industry.

Recently, Deepika Padukone made news as fans were disappointed when they got to know that DP might be signing a film with #MeToo accused filmmaker Luv Ranjan. Similar reports claimed that DP would be doing the film with Ranbir Kapoor and Ajay Devgn.

Agencies

This left many fans disappointed. While there still has been no clarity on the reports, DP had time and again claimed that she would not work with someone accused of sexual misconduct. In a recent interview with DNA, DP opened about the #MeToo movement. Talking about the movement, she said,

Agencies

"You should ask some cricketers about the #MeToo movement. I don't see that happening. But every actor is asked about the #MeToo movement. It's not something that's happening only in the film industry."

She added,

"So, sure, I don't think I'm in any kind of place to say if I would expose myself to a forum. You can ask me whatever question you want, but why subject it only to a film star? As responsible people, should we not have an opinion? All our opinions should matter then, right?"

On the professional front, Deepika has Chhapaak and '83 releasing in January. She recently hosted a grand bash for the entire team of 83 after they wrapped up the shoot.
